meanings.definition: a government program that provides jobs for people who are unemployed
meanings.sent1: The workfares initiative helped many jobless individuals find employment.
meanings.sent2: She participated in the workfares program to secure a job.
meanings.sent3: The workfares scheme turned unemployment into opportunities for many.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of joblessness, workfares acted as a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: The impact of workfares on reducing unemployment rates was remarkable.

meanings.definition: the act of performing labor in exchange for welfare benefits
meanings.sent1: His decision to join workfares allowed him to receive welfare support.
meanings.sent2: Workfares required individuals to work in return for assistance.
meanings.sent3: The workfares arrangement made earning welfare a productive endeavor.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of welfare, workfares added a new dimension to support.
meanings.sent5: The concept of workfares reshaped the welfare system for the better.
